titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Northrup collection on Brooklyn history 1986.008
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.unittitle: Northrup collection on Brooklyn and Long Island history

physdesc.extent: in one folder and one flat file folder.

did.abstract: This collection contains early 20th century clippings and publications relating to various Brooklyn and Long Island historical events.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Northrup collection on Brooklyn and Long Island history, 1986.008, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024. At that time, preservation photocopies were created of all clippings and the originals discarded. Also, "Long Island" was added to the collection name to better reflect its contents.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Crow-Step by Georgia Fraser, PZ3.F8627 C76 1910
The stone house at Gowanus by Georgia Fraser, E241.L8 F8 1909

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains clippings and publications about various Brooklyn and New York historical events. Topics include the Bushwick Riot of 1696; William Alexander, Earl of Stirling (in a booklet written by Charles Ditmas and published by the Kings County Historical Society); the Lott family; coats of arms of Colonial era American families; Henry Remsen and the Bank of the Manhattan Company; Brooklyn's first schoolteacher; the unveiling of a Battle of Brooklyn monument in Green-Wood Cemetery; and Newtown (oversize newspaper supplement in flat file). The collection also includes one Hyde's Pocket Map of Queens, dated 1908 (in flat file). Additionally, there is a set of clippings comprising a serialized version of Georgia Fraser's 1910 novel Crow-Step, which is a romance set during the Dutch colonial era in Brooklyn. A 1955 clipping from the Hanover Gazette covers an award won by Bill Cunningham, whose connection to the other contents of this collection is unclear.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
